dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Guess there's no time to waste. I've got a lot I should do before heading out to the woods.
During the day, you can build your skills by visiting different locations. Building a skill costs 1 action.
Make sure to watch the sun meter on the right. Once Sunny has taken six actions, the day will end.
It's locked

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: It's been pretty empty in there for a while. I wonder how the bells still go off.

dialogue.speaker: Gemma
dialogue.text: Sunny! I'm glad you came by. I think some of my books could tell us a lot about the shards you need to collect, and maybe helpful for dealing with those creatures in the woods.

dialogue.speaker: Gemma
dialogue.text: It's unfortunate that it took this happening for people to believe me. Besides you. You've always been so nice to me, Sunny.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: They told me my hobbies were pretty far-fetched too, but we're proving them wrong now, huh? You knew about magic and stars, and I was dead on about how much a sword would come in handy.

dialogue.speaker: Gemma
dialogue.text: Hehe, you're right. So, what do you think we should do?
Gemma plops a dusty tome in front of you on the table. You two skim the pages, gathering information on the special properties of stars.
You gain 1 point in Intutition.

dialogue.speaker: Gemma
dialogue.text: O-oh? You really want to study magic with me?
Though taken by surprise, Gemma begins to teach you the basics of magic.
You gain 1 point in Magic.

dialogue.speaker: Gemma
dialogue.text: How are you holding up? Do you think you can really handle these... things?

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm sure I can handle it.

dialogue.speaker: Gemma
dialogue.text: We still don't know much about them. I wouldn't let your guard down.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I'll be okay. I promise. I'm not gonna let anyone in town get hurt by these things.

dialogue.speaker: Gemma
dialogue.text: I wish I could go with you, but I'd just drag you down.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: No, no, you're doing great here. Your research is going to help me a lot.

dialogue.speaker: Gemma
dialogue.text: Good luck, Sunny!

dialogue.speaker: Lulu
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Sunny! What could I help you with?

dialogue.speaker: Lulu
dialogue.text: Of course. Let me show you what we've got in stock.

dialogue.speaker: Lulu
dialogue.text: It's so brave of you to go out into the woods, dear. I must urge you to be careful.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: No need to worry about me, Lu. I'm pretty sturdy.

dialogue.speaker: Lulu
dialogue.text: I know. As small as you are, you've always been a fighter.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Pff. Here I am, saving the whole town, and you insult me.

dialogue.speaker: Lulu
dialogue.text: I'm just playing around with you, Sunny. But I hope you know that you can back out at any time.

dialogue.speaker: Lulu
dialogue.text: None of us want you to risk your life out there, and you're welcome to spend the night with me if you need to get patched up.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Thanks, Lu.

dialogue.speaker: Lulu
dialogue.text: Take care, you hear?

dialogue.speaker: Hal
dialogue.text: Sunny? Is that you?

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Yeah... I thought I should get back in shape if I'm gonna rough up some monsters.

dialogue.speaker: Hal
dialogue.text: Fantastic! I'd be happy to train you. What do you want to work on?
While you refuse to run, you are willing to mount the stationary bike. Under Hal's guidance, you work up quite a sweat.
You gain 1 point in Stamina.
You pull on some boxing clubs and start to go toe to toe with Hal. You can't beat him... yet.
You gain 1 point in Strength.

dialogue.speaker: Hal
dialogue.text: What's up?

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I was just wondering why you aren't coming out into the woods with me. What's holding you back?

dialogue.speaker: Hal
dialogue.text: I just don't know what we're up against. My family's here and I feel that I can protect them better if I stay with them.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I understand. It's definitely a risk, and I wouldn't ask you to leave your family behind.

dialogue.speaker: Hal
dialogue.text: I believe in you, Sunny. I bet you can take those monsters out without a scratch.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: We'll see about that.

dialogue.speaker: Hal
dialogue.text: See you, Sunny!

dialogue.speaker: Greyson
dialogue.text: Hey Sunny!

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Hey Greyson! Are you working the store alone today?

dialogue.speaker: Greyson
dialogue.text: Yup. Trevor and Judd are out getting some things for the store, but I'm doing just fine on my own.

dialogue.speaker: Greyson
dialogue.text: Anyway, what can I get you?

dialogue.speaker: Greyson
dialogue.text: Take a look! We've got some really good deals in today.

dialogue.speaker: Greyson
dialogue.text: How's it been getting ready for tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I don't know yet, really. I feel like I should be doing lots of things, but there's only so much time in a day.

dialogue.speaker: Greyson
dialogue.text: You're kinda going in blind on this one. I'm sure after tonight is over, you'll have a much better idea of what you're doing.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I hope so. Everyone here's counting on me. I want to take care of this as soon as I can.

dialogue.speaker: Greyson
dialogue.text: Don't worry so much. You're going to be amazing.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Thanks, Greyson.

dialogue.speaker: Greyson
dialogue.text: Come around any time!

dialogue.speaker: Ivy
dialogue.text: Oh, hello Sunny. Are you feeling alright?

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I'm doing just fine, doc. I was actually wondering if you could help me with something else.

dialogue.speaker: Ivy
dialogue.text: What can I help you with?

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Anything you can teach me for patching myself up if those things get a good swipe at me?

dialogue.speaker: Ivy
dialogue.text: I could definitely help you with that. How about you come back with me and I'll go through it with you.
Ivy walks you through multiple ways of blocking against severe damage.
You gain 1 point in Defense.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Is there anything I could do to be... more resilient, I guess?

dialogue.speaker: Ivy
dialogue.text: Well, there are a lot of long term habits you can get into to be healthier, but... I do know of some experimental things we can try.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Sounds perfect! Lay it on me.
Ivy brings out multiple odd-looking plants from the back of the clinic. You wonder if this was such a good idea when she has you eat them.
You gain 1 point in Health.

dialogue.speaker: Ivy
dialogue.text: Today's a big day for you, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: It seems to be a big day for all of us.

dialogue.speaker: Ivy
dialogue.text: I suppose you're right. I hope we're not pressuring you too much.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: It's fine. I get that everyone's pretty shaken up about all this.

dialogue.speaker: Ivy
dialogue.text: Our town's pretty quiet for the most part. Remember when a tree fell over on one of the electrical lines and it was like an earthquake had hit?

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Heh, yeah. We're not equipped to deal with the unusual, are we?

dialogue.speaker: Ivy
dialogue.text: I think you'll be, Sunny.

dialogue.speaker: Ivy
dialogue.text: Try not to land yourself in here, Sunny.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I make no promises.

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: Hey. I was wondering if I'd get to catch you before you left.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: You did just in time.

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: I imagine you're going to be busy for a while now.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I'm trying to be. The sooner we get to the bottom of this, the better.

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: Yeah, of course...

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: Sunny, you know you don't have to do this, right?

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Aww, you worried about me, Polly?

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: Yeah. I am.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I'm gonna be fine.

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: Please tell me you're not just doing this to impress Gemma.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: ... W-what? No, of course not. I'm doing this for everyone, Apollo.

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: Sunny...

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: I swear. I'm not just doing it for that.

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: Alright. I'm glad to hear that at least. You know I like Gemma too - not like you do, of course - but her whole star thing kinda freaks me out.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: She knows more about this than the rest of us.

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: Exactly! Isn't that... kind of fishy? I mean we didn't take her seriously for so long and now-

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Gemma's not the cause of this. I want to know what's going on just as much as you do, but we shouldn't throw each other under the bus.

dialogue.speaker: Apollo
dialogue.text: ... Okay, you're right. I'm sorry for sounding like a jerk.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Hey, everyone around here's pretty stressed. Don't worry about it.

dialogue.speaker: Sunny
dialogue.text: Guess it's time to head out.
